PROJECT PREPARATORY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE 
(South Asia Subregional Economic Cooperation (SASEC) Power System Expansion 
Project) 
 
A.  Justification 
1.  The project will consist of subprojects selected on the basis of economic optimality and 
national  priorities.    The  S-PPTA  approved  in  December  2012  helps  identify  the  scope  of 
subprojects to be included in the Project, and make initial assessment on technical, financial, 
economic, environmental and social aspects of the selected subprojects. The outputs of the S-
PPTA are the inputs of the PPTA, which will conduct full-fledged due diligence on technical, 
economic, financial, social and environmental aspects of the subprojects to be identified through 
the S-PPTA, prepare the ensuing loan, and improve the project readiness. The PPTA resources 
will be used to prepare the project for ADB financing considering these aspects.

C.  Cost Estimate and Proposed Financing Arrangement

by the trust fund1, and administered by ADB. The government will provide counterpart support in 
the form of counterpart staff, provision of office space, and other in-kind contributions. The 
detailed cost estimate is presented in Table A5.2.

D.  Consulting Services 
4.  A total of 74 person months of consultancy services will be required to prepare the 
project.  ADB will recruit the consultants in accordance with its Guidelines on the Use of 
Consultants (2013, as amended from time to time). The power system specialist (international), 
procurement specialist (international) and the power sector policy specialist will be recruited as 
individual consultants.  A firm will be engaged to provide the remaining consultancy services.  
The consulting firm will be selected according to quality- and cost-based selection procedures 
using the standard quality-cost ratio of 90:10. 
 
Table A5.3: Summary of Consulting Services Requirement

5.  The consultants will assist NEA in finalizing the feasibility study, defining the project, 
preparing conceptual designs and technical specifications and bidding documents, supporting 
the biding process and bid evaluation. The outline terms of reference for the project preparatory 
TA consultants are described in paras. 6 to 18.  
 
6.  Power System Specialist (International, individual). The consultant should have a degree 
in electrical engineering. The consultant will act as the coordinator between ADB mission leader 
and  the  consultants,  supervise  the  activities  of  consultants,  and  control  the  quality  of  the 
outputs. The consultant will also conduct other duties as reasonably requested by ADB project 
officer. 
 
7.  Procurement  Specialist  (International,  individual).  The  consultant  should  have  a 
minimum bachelor degree, and have a minimum of 5 years experience in similar procurement 
related  assignments  for  ADB  funded  projects.  The  consultant  will  be  responsible  for  the 
assessment  of  procurement  and  implementation  capacity  of  the  NEA  and  reviewing  and 
finalizing the costs estimates, contract packaging, procurement plan, project implementation

4 
 
plan, and the draft bidding documents prepared by NEA. The consultant will also conduct other 
duties as reasonably requested by ADB project officer. 
 
8.  Power  Sector  Policy  Specialist  (National,  individual).  The  consultant should  have  a 
degree in energy policy or economy. The consultant will collect and review the policies, rules 
and regulations in energy sector of Nepal, and dialogue with government agencies in power 
sector (Ministry of Energy, Department of Electricity Development, Electricity Tariff Fixation 
Committee, NEA and other concerned agencies). Based on the discussions and findings, the 
consultant shall identify the sector and institutional issues/needs of reform, and recommend 
activities to enhance sector/institutional governance and improve power sector performance. 
The consultant shall also conduct other duties as reasonable requested by ADB project officer. 
 
9.  Team Leader/Transmission Electrical Engineer (International): The consultant should 
have at least Bachelor’s degree in a relevant engineering discipline and minimum 10 years’ 
working experience. Experience shall cover 400kV or higher EHV transmission line design, 
specification, construction, testing and commissioning. The consultant will be the team leader of 
the consulting firm. The consultant will conduct the tasks including but not limited to: 
 
(i)  Update and finalize the power sector assessment. 
(ii)  With the assistance of the consultant team, perform a training needs assessment for 
counterpart staff and prepare a training program. 
(iii)  Make necessary inputs and advice to the project team and to NEA on transmission 
line and transmission substation technical matters. 
(iv)  Prepare the Inception Report 
(v)  Prepare regular reports in accordance with ADB requirements. 
(vi)  Contribute to capacity building of NEA counterpart staff. 
(vii)  Coordinate the preparation of project designs, documentation, bidding documents. 
(viii)  Assist NEA in evaluation of technical and financial bids to be received against ICB 
for engagement of turnkey contractor, preparation of bid evaluation reports, contract 
negotiations and draft contract agreements, and advice on submission of documents 
to ADB for review and approval. 
(ix)  Conduct other duties as reasonably requested by ADB project officer. 
 
10.  Transmission  Electrical  Engineer  (national).    The  consultant  should  have  a  higher 
degree in electrical engineering together with 5 years of experience in energy sector project 
development. The consultant will carry out, but not be limited to, the following tasks: 
 
(i)  Provide logistical, secretarial, and research support during meetings, interviews, and 
workshops;  
(ii)  Conduct secondary research for data and information through one-one-one meetings 
and/or interviews with implementing partners and appropriate stakeholder groups to 
gather  inputs,  necessary  to  carry  out  each  of  the  tasks  under  the TOR  of  the 
international power engineer; and 
(iii)  Perform other functions as may be assigned or delegated by the team leader from 
time to time during the assignment. 
 
11.  Economist  (international  and  national).  The  consultant  should  have  a  degree  in 
economics and will be responsible for the assessment of the economic viability of the project.  
Economic analysis and related sensitivity studies will be carried out for each of the sub project

5 
 
and for the entire project.  In consultation with others, the consultant will also examine the CDM 
opportunities in the project and prepare necessary documentation. 
 
12.  Financial Specialist (international and national). The consultant should have a degree or 
equivalent in finance or accountancy and will be responsible for the assessment of the financial 
viability of the project. The consultant will review and finalize the design of the funds flow and 
disbursement mechanisms for the ensuing project, based on financial management assessment 
(FMA) of executing/implementing agencies, and identify any further capacity building (financial 
management and ADB’s disbursement procedures) that will be necessary for the project, based 
on the results of the FMA. Financial analysis and related sensitivity studies shall be carried out 
for each of the sub project and for the entire project.  Past financial performance of NEA and its 
financial projections will also be analyzed and presented.  
 
13.  Environmental Specialist (international and national). The consultants should have a 
degree in a relevant discipline. He/She will be responsible for the environmental safeguard 
assessments and developing (or reviewing and finalizing) required documentation in line with 
ADB guidelines and Nepal environmental regulations.   
 
14.  Social Safeguard Specialist (international and national). The consultants should have a 
degree in a relevant discipline.  He/She will be responsible for the social safeguard and GESI 
assessments and developing (or reviewing and finalizing) required documentation that includes 
Resettlement Plan, Consultation and Participation Plan, and GESI Action Plan in line with ADB 
guidelines and relevant Nepal regulations.  He/She also will conduct the necessary surveys to 
establish caste- and sex-disaggregated baseline socio-economic data in the project areas. 
 
15.  Poverty and gender specialist (International and national).  The consultants should have 
a degree in a relevant discipline. He or she will identify issues related to pro-poor and gender-
inclusive  access  to  energy  resources  and  services;  document  promising  and/or  emerging 
practices in Nepal for possible incorporation in the project, and identify modalities through which 
the project can effectively promote the poor, vulnerable groups and women's greater access to 
energy resources, services and opportunities.  Also a Gender Action Plan will be prepared. 
 
16.  Line Survey Engineer (International):  With at least Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering 
or  surveying  and minimum  7  years  experience,  with  previous  experience  internationally  in 
developing countries and with 400kV or above transmission lines and substations.  Experience 
shall include route definition, and tower spotting and in mountainous terrain and environmentally 
and socially sensitive situations.  The expert shall have an understanding of line clearances and 
safety considerations. The consultant will carry out, but not be limited to, the following tasks: 
 
(i)  Perform an on site route assessment in conjunction with the NEA survey team. 
(ii)  Make necessary inputs and advice to the project team and to NEA on transmission 
line and transmission substation survey and location matters. 
(iii)  Contribute to capacity building of NEA counterpart staff. 
(iv)  Assist with the preparation of project designs, documentation, bidding documents. 
(v)  Perform other functions as may be assigned or delegated by Team Leader from time 
to time during the time of assignment. 
 
17.  Structural Engineer – Transmission/Substations (International):  With at least Bachelor’s 
degree  in  structural  engineering,  with  minimum  10  years’  experience  in  the  selection  and 
specification of transmission and substation towers and structures for 400kV or higher.  The 
consultant will carry out, but not be limited to, the following tasks:

6 
 
 
(i)  Make necessary inputs and advice to the project team and to NEA on transmission 
line and transmission substation structural matters. 
(ii)  Contribute to capacity building of NEA counterpart staff. 
(iii)  Assist  and  advise  with  the  preparation  of  project  design criteria for towers  and 
substation structures, documentation, bidding documents. 
(iv)  Assist  NEA  in  evaluation  of  technical  and  financial  bids  to  be  received  for 
engagement of turnkey contractor, preparation of bid evaluation reports, contract 
negotiations and draft contract agreements, and advice on submission of documents 
to ADB for review and approval. 
(v)  Perform other functions as may be assigned or delegated by Team Leader from time 
to time during the time of assignment.  
 
18.  Electrical Engineer – Substations (International):  With at least Bachelor’s degree in 
structural engineering, with minimum 10 years’ experience in the selection and specification of 
transmission and substation towers and structures for 400kV or higher.  The consultant will 
carry out, but not be limited to, the following tasks: 
 
(i)  Make necessary inputs and advice to the project team and to NEA on transmission 
line and transmission substation technical matters. 
(ii)  Contribute to capacity building of NEA counterpart staff. 
(iii)  Coordinate the preparation of project designs, documentation, bidding documents. 
(iv)  Assist NEA in evaluation of technical and financial bids to be received against ICB 
for engagement of turnkey contractor, preparation of bid evaluation reports, contract 
negotiations and draft contract agreements, and advice on submission of documents 
to ADB for review and approval. 
(v)  Perform other functions as may be assigned or delegated by Team Leader from time 
to time during the time of assignment.  
 
E.  Implementation Arrangements 
19.  Nepal Electricity Authority will be the executing and the implementing agency of the 
PPTA.  NEA will provide in-kind contributions in the form of office space for the consultants and 
allocating counterpart staff. The equipment purchased under the PPTA will be transferred to 
NEA  on  the  completion  of  the  TA.  All  disbursements  under  the  PPTA  will  be  made  in 
accordance with the Technical Assistance Disbursement Handbook (2010, as amended from 
time to time). 
 
20.  The proposed TA processing and implementation schedule is listed in Table 5.4.  
 
Table 5.4: Proposed Technical Assistance Processing and Implementation Schedule 
Expected 
Major Milestones  Completion Date 
VP approval of the project concept paper  Jul 2013 
Recruitment of Consultants  Jul 2013 
Mobilize consultants  Oct 2013 
PPTA completion   Dec 2015 
ADB = Asian Development Bank; PPTA = project preparatory technical Assistance  
Source: Asian Development Bank staff estimates
